name: Front-End Design/Engineering Tools & Techniques acquired from The Iron Yard Coding BootCamp Experience
tagline: curated by Rob DeSousa & feedback provided by the Houston Class of Summer 2014
body:
Class Projects & Instructions ============================= ####Github Profile Page of TIY Students using Github API: >[Profile Page Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/Profile_Page) ####Semi-parallax of clock, stopWatch while changing background color + button commands: >[Clock Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/Clock_Bkgd) ####ETSY API to show listings: >[ETSY API Exercise](http://tiy-api.herokuapp.com) ####Unit-Functionality-Testing: >[Clock Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/TDD) *** ## Instruction Node.JS: >1. clone / copy the files to project directory. >2. `npm init` >3. `npm install` >4. `node server.js` ##Pushing to Github Repo: >1. `mkdir ` >2. `git clone ` >3. `git add --all` >4. `git commit -am " "` >5. `git push` ##Branching & creating url from gh-pages in Github: >1. `git branch` >2. `git checkout -b gh-pages` >3. `git merge master` <------- if you updated master >4. `git push origin gh-pages` >5. `git checkout master` <------- go back to master, where you make your updates to code #Tools ====== ##1. Class Projects ####Github Profile Page of TIY Students using Github API: >[Profile Page Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/Profile_Page) ####Semi-parallax of clock, stopWatch while changing background color + button commands: >[Clock Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/Clock_Bkgd) ####ETSY API to show listings: >[ETSY API Exercise](http://tiy-api.herokuapp.com) ####Unit-Functionality-Testing: >[Clock Exercise](https://robdesousa.github.com/The-Iron-Yard-Experience/TDD) *** ## Instructions to install Node.JS via Terminal: >1. clone / copy the files to local project directory. >2. `npm init` >3. `npm install` >4. `node server.js` ##Pulling/Pushing to Github Repo: >1. `mkdir ` >2. `git clone ` >3. `git add --all` >4. `git commit -am " "` >5. `git push` ###Creating your Github url `http:username.github.io///` from the gh-pages branch via Terminal: >1. `git branch` >2. `git checkout -b gh-pages` >3. `git merge master` <------- if you updated master >4. `git push origin gh-pages` >5. `git checkout master` <------- go back to master, where you make your updates to code ###Git instructions for Heroku Live Server via Terminal >1. `git remote remove heroku` \\ If the domain/url/app name changes >2. `git remote add heroku (url)` \\ Add automatically generated URL domain name >3. `git remote -v` \\Get a list view with heroku >4. `heroku create` \\ Create a random Heroku server >5. `git remote -v` \\ This will register a remote git endpoint which should now show Github (origin) and Heroku >6. `heroku ps:scale web=1` \\ To spin-up some resources for your app >7. `git push heroku master` \\ Finally push your code repo up to Heroku (yes it can be pushed to Github OR Heroku!) >8. Anytime you want to push to the same heroku server, you only need to repeat **step 6**. >[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/ddollar/foreman.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/ddollar/foreman) >[![Code Climate](https://codeclimate.com/github/ddollar/foreman.png)](https://codeclimate.com/github/ddollar/foreman) ============ ###REST API in order build your own Web App: We used in the ETSY-API project the following tools, JS libraries and frameworks: >- Node Server.js >- Routing >- JQuery & JSON >- MVC (Model View Controller) >- Heroku App Server >- Lodash >- Temp DB *** Manage applications
If you have... Install with...
Frameworks 
Should go here
Mac OS X
